com.basistech.tclre

Interface ReMatcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MatchResult

    public interface ReMatcher
extends MatchResult
    A matcher; an object that uses a regular expression to search or match. A has a CharSequence that it applies to; it is created over one, and can be switched to a new one with reset(CharSequence). Matchers perform two operations: matching and searching. Matching (matches() attempts to satisfy the pattern with the entire string. Searching scans forward through the string looking for a substring that satisfies the pattern.
    A matcher has a region. Initially, the region is the entire data, but the application may call region(int, int) to change it. Setting a region limits the data examined by the matcher, but does not change the interpretation of the offset passed to find(int) or the values returned by the methods of MatchResult. These are always relative to the complete data.
    Matchers support an iterative scanning process for multiple matches. After a successful call to find() or find(int), the matcher retains the offset of the end of the match. A subsequent call to find() starts at the character after the previous match.

    • Method Detail

      • pattern

        RePattern pattern()
        Returns:
        the pattern that produced this matcher.

      • find

        boolean find(int startOffset)
        Search for the pattern in the data, starting at the specified offset. If this returns true, then the methods from MatchResult return information about the match.
        Parameters:
        startOffset - an offset relative to the beginning of the data.
        Returns:
        true if the pattern was found

      • find

        boolean find()
        Search for the pattern in the data, starting at the end of the previous match. If there was no previous match, starts at the beginning of the region.
        Returns:
        if the pattern was found

      • region

        ReMatcher region(int start,
               int end)
        Specify a region that bounds searching and matching. The region is [start, end]. This resets the current search position to the start of the region.
        Parameters:
        start - the start offset, relative to the entire data.
        end - the end offset, relative to the entire data.
        Returns:
        this matcher.

      • reset

        ReMatcher reset()
        Reset this matcher to the state as of the creation or the last call to reset(CharSequence).
        Returns:
        this matcher

      • reset

        ReMatcher reset(CharSequence newSequence)
        Change the data for this matcher. The region is set to the entire sequence, and the previous match information is reset.
        Parameters:
        newSequence - the new data.
        Returns:
        this matcher

      • flags

        ReMatcher flags(ExecFlags... flags)
        Change the flags associated with this matcher.
        Parameters:
        flags - the new flags.
        Returns:
        this matcher.

      • flags

        EnumSet<ExecFlags> flags()
        Returns:
        return the current set of flags associated with this matcher.

      • matches

        boolean matches()
        Perform a match operation.
        Returns:
        true if the pattern is satisfied by the entire region.

        int regionStart()
        Returns:
        the current region start.

        int regionEnd()
        Returns:

      • lookingAt

        attempt to satisfy the pattern with the characters starting at the current position.
        Returns:
